topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Deploy the Horizon Patch

body.section:
This patch fixes an API error that prevents a user from creating a PCI-Passthrough or SR-IOV interface using the Horizon UI. The user was able create those interfces using CLI.
If you can create PCI-Passthrough and SR-IOV interfaces in Horizon, this patch was applied during installation, disregard these steps.

Download the patch
If you have not downloaded the patch, launch the Helion Distribution Network (HDN). You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files. In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Download the patch and the associated checksum and signature files.
Verify the downloaded signature and the downloaded checksums.
Extract the compressed files until the HZN-HCG-1011 directory is available.

section.title: Install the patch
section.p:
Execute the following commands:
Log onto the lifecycle manager VM.ssh <HLM_VM_IP>
where: HLM_VM_IP is the CLM IP of the lifecycle manager. Locate the IP address for the lifecycle manager in the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file under hlm_clmstaticip field.
Copy the HZN-HCG-1011 directory to the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/patches directory on the lifecycle manager.
Execute following command to apply patch hlm patch -c <cloud-name> -n HZN-HCG-1011 -t <tier>
Where: <tier> is the tier on which the various controllers are running. For example: hlm patch -c sac36 -n HZN-HZN-1011 -t BASE-CCP-T2The tier information can be found in the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/desired_state/<cloudname>/001/base/stage/ansible/hosts file.
